intro: Glossorhyncha diffusa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Glossorhyncha diffusa is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some areas.
